text: Magdalen College School is an independent school for boys. It is on the edge of central Oxford, England. It was founded as part of Magdalen College, Oxford by Thomas Becket in 1480 The school was originally founded by William Waynflete to educate the sixteen boy choristers of Magdalen College, Oxford University who sang in the college's chapel. Important Old Waynfletes include William Tyndale, Sam Mendes, Alex Lennox, Tim Hunt, and Ben Goldacre. == Other websites == * Magdalen College School website * ISI inspection report * A history of the choristers of Magdalen College School, Oxford Category:Schools in England Category:1480s establishments Category:15th-century establishments in England
title: Magdalen College School, Oxford
